library(tidyverse)

## Intro to R - ERIM Course

### Part 1) Sketching plots
In this section, I have sketched multiple plots with different features and aspects.
```{r Plot1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.height=3, fig.pos ="H"}
ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = prestige, y = logincome, size = women)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21, color = "black", fill = "red") +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", show.legend = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "logincome vs Prestige")

ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = prestige)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Prestige")

ggplot(data = mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Engine Capacity vs. Hwy Fuel Consumption", caption = "The relationship is illustrated among different differentials")

ggplot(mpg, aes(cty, hwy)) +
  geom_point() +
  facet_grid( ~ fl)

ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = class)) +
  geom_bar() +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Blues") +
  labs(title = "Welcome", caption = "This is the subtitle")

ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = class)) +
  geom_bar() +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "terrain_hcl")

ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = class)) + 
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Reds")

ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = education, y = prestige, fill = type)) + 
  geom_point(shape = 21, size = 2) + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)

ggplot(mpg, aes(x = cty, y = hwy, fill = cty)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21, size = 3) +
  scale_fill_continuous(low = "white", high = "magenta")

ggplot(mpg, aes(x = cyl)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()

ggplot(Prestige, aes(x = type, y = prestige, fill = type)) +
  geom_boxplot(show.legend = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Prestige of Type",
       caption = "")

ggplot(Eredivisie, aes(x = Year, y = Points, color = Team)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "red")) +
  ylim(0, 120) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = 1996), color = "grey") +
  geom_hline(aes(yintercept = c(8, 89)), color = "grey") +
  labs(title = "Ajax vs. Feyenoord", caption = "Comparing the points of the two teams from year 1956 to 2016. A ylimit of (0-120) has been implemented.")
```


This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
